image.altText: Mother and daughter take a photo in a creek.

props.synopsis: Alicia May filmed the swim with her children at a popular creek, but it was only when she was watching the footage that she spotted a dark shape lurking beneath the surface. Wildlife officers later estimated it to be a 3m crocodile.

title.children: Mother swimming with children unknowingly films 'sizeable' crocodile at popular Townsville swimming spot

image.altText: A grey-haired, bespectacled man in a suit outside a court building.

props.synopsis: Peter Lang has denied all 22 charges brought against him. His accusers say they were 13 years old when he arranged to meet with them in the 1980s.

title.children: Former radio celebrity on trial for alleged sexual assault of schoolgirls who called to request songs

image.altText: A mother holds her baby in a hospital ward.

props.synopsis: Parents are questioning the standard of care at for-profit childcare centres amid a worker shortage and wage negotiations.

title.children: 'She wasn't breathing well': Ada's childcare centre should have known of her allergy. They fed her dairy anyway

image.altText: Xi Jinping sits at a wooden bench with two teacups on saucers sitting in front of him

props.synopsis: China's government uses its most important political meeting of the year, the National People's Congress, to respond to increasing pressure over its dire economic situation, outlining a plan to grow GDP and boost spending on defence.

title.children: China's economy is teetering towards crisis. This is Xi's plan to pull it back from the brink

image.altText: Terry Irving in Townsville prison in 1994-95.

props.synopsis: Terry Irving was imprisoned for a crime he didn't commit. Now the justice system will be asked to answer the ultimate question: What's the cost of loss of liberty?

title.children: Terry was jailed for a crime he didn't commit. After 30 years, he'll finally learn the price of freedom

image.altText: A Taurus missile flies during a drill off the coast of South Korea.

props.synopsis: An audio recording of German military officers discussing the hypothetical use of Taurus missiles in Ukraine is leaked to Russian state media, embarrassing Germany and leading to accusations it was preparing for war.

title.children: Russia has accused Germany of preparing for war after a leaked military conversation. How did this happen?

image.altText: A young man with redish hair and wearing a checked shirt looks out from a balcony.

props.synopsis: Travis Mathews' story has never been made public, until now. He's speaking out about his experience at Sydney's Cranbrook School as part of a Four Corners investigation.

title.children: Former Cranbrook student says he was repeatedly sexually abused at private boys' school

image.altText: A selfie of a man on a street

props.synopsis: A man who police allege sexually assaulted a woman after picking her up in Toowoomba's CBD at the weekend has cried in court after being refused bail.

title.children: 'Other potential victims' come forward after man faces court over alleged rideshare kidnapping

image.altText: A blurred image showing two children against a garage door, and a man next to then with arms crossed.

props.synopsis: A man has been taken into custody after a "confronting" incident, with video showing two children aged six and seven restrained with cable ties at a Broome home.

title.children: Man taken into custody after allegedly restraining two children with cable ties at Broome home

image.altText: Two storey house half-burnt by lithium battery fire

props.synopsis: Two people killed in a Lake Macquarie house fire last week appear to be the state's first casualties from a lithium-ion battery-related blaze, Fire and Rescue NSW (FRNSW) says.

title.children: Two killed in NSW house blaze believed to be state's first recorded lithium-ion battery-related deaths

image.altText: Jingili murder accused video still

props.synopsis: Dramatic vision of the moment police arrested murder accused Warren Dhamarrandji in Jingili in 2020 has been played at his NT Supreme Court trial, showing police running up to the man, pushing him off his bike and onto the ground.

title.children: Bodyworn video showing dramatic arrest of Warren Dhamarrandji aired at Darwin murder trial

image.altText: A wide shot of a rocket blasting off from a launch pad into a clear sky, with flames and clouds of smoke below it

props.synopsis: The Optimus satellite is packed with Australian-made tech, and aims to help keep other satellites in space.

title.children: Australian company's satellite-repairing satellite blasts into space on SpaceX rocket

image.altText: Man with glasses wearing a suit and tie

props.synopsis: The father of four children who died between the years of 1989 and 1999 in the Hunter region, died earlier this week.

title.children: Craig Folbigg, former husband of Kathleen Folbigg, dies after heart attack

image.altText: A screenshot of St Kilda's Jimmy Webster hitting North Melbourne's Jy Simpkin high in an AFL preseason game.

props.synopsis: The AFL tribunal says the need to avoid head-high impact in the game has never been more acute, as it hands down a "significant sanction" to Saints player Jimmy Webster for his hit on North's Jy Simpkin in a trial match.

title.children: St Kilda's Webster handed lengthy ban at AFL tribunal for 'entirely avoidable' hit on Simpkin

image.altText: Drone footage showing a Chinese Coast Guard boat coming close to a Phillipine Coast Guard boat.

props.synopsis: Philippines accuses China's coast guard of carrying out "dangerous manoeuvres" that led to a collision between its coast guard ship and a Chinese vessel during a resupply mission for Philippine troops in the South China Sea.

title.children: Philippines accuses China of 'dangerous manoeuvres' after coast guard ships collide

image.altText: A woman in a flowing blue dress arrives at a court building surrounded by cameras

props.synopsis: Brittany Higgins and her partner David Sharaz attend a mediation session with Ms Higgins' former employer, Senator Linda Reynolds.

title.children: Mediation starts after Senator Linda Reynolds sues Brittany Higgins and partner over alleged defamatory posts

image.altText: The words "Fire and Rescue" on the side of a truck.

props.synopsis: Authorities shut down a major gas pipeline as investigations begin into a "significant" blaze that flared up in central Queensland this morning.

title.children: Gas pipeline fire triggers warning for major industrial companies to stop or limit gas usage

image.altText: A close up of red ant in soil.

props.synopsis: The head of a peak NSW farming body calls for practical biosecurity solutions to deal with fire ants, instead of "people swanning around" on overseas research trips and theoretical chats.

title.children: Fire ant Senate inquiry hears NSW farmers 'infuriated' at 'chronic failures' in managing pest

image.altText: A composite image of Sinead O'Connor performing and Donald Trump talking into a mic

props.synopsis: The US presidential hopeful has been playing the late musician's trademark hit Nothing Compares 2 U at political rallies and campaign events.

title.children: Sinéad O'Connor's estate reminds Donald Trump she thought he was the 'biblical devil' and demands he stop using her music

image.altText: An aerial shot of Lake Malbena, half in sunlight, half in shade. A beautiful still lake surrounded by green forests.

props.synopsis: Humans are wreaking havoc on our most cherished places and tourism is a significant and growing contributor to the chaos, writes Linton Besser.

title.children: This island risks being transformed into a consumer experience for the wealthy. Should it be a wake-up call?

image.altText: The Yallourn Power station emits a cloud of white vapour.

props.synopsis: With the Coalition interested in replacing retiring coal plants with nuclear reactors, there are just a handful of regions that would be likely candidates under the opposition's yet to be announced plans to go nuclear.

title.children: Five regions shaping up as favoured candidates for nuclear reactors under Coalition plan, as it eyes retiring coal stations

image.altText: Sam Kerr walking along a field.

props.synopsis: Matildas captain Sam Kerr has been charged over alleged racially aggravated harassment of a police officer in London early last year.

title.children: Football Australia not informed of charges against Sam Kerr

image.altText: A blurred photo of a car with trees in the background

props.synopsis: The Australian Automobile Association's latest report reveals the cost of getting around capital cities and regional centres. We also zeroed in on essentials like fuel and public transport.

title.children: How expensive is travel in each capital city? We ranked the cost of fuel and public transport

image.altText: Meektharra terrain

props.synopsis: Police say a father and son have died while prospecting on a remote station in WA's Murchison region.

title.children: Father and son found dead while prospecting in WA's hot and remote outback

image.altText: A man and a woman sitting at a table with a photo album displayed in front of them.

props.synopsis: Bert Janssen underwent transplant surgery in June, 1984, at age 17, when he was diagnosed with cardiomyopathy, a heart muscle disease that makes it harder for the heart to function.

title.children: Bert was given six months to live after his heart transplant — he now holds the record for longest-surviving patient

image.altText: A soldier in camo holding a gun.

props.synopsis: The attack occurred just hours after authorities in Haiti ordered a night-time curfew following violence in which armed gang members overran the two biggest prisons and freed thousands of inmates over the weekend.

title.children: Gangs in Haiti try to seize control of main airport in latest attack on key government sites

image.altText: A Horizon Power bill, showing the homeowner owes $588

props.synopsis: Australians say they're experiencing heat stroke as they battle power bills amid record heatwaves across the country, a new report by the Australian Council of Social Services finds.

title.children: Cost-of-living stress causing poor health in Australia's most vulnerable, says new report

image.altText: A single-storey home with a tree in the front yard and a wire fence.

props.synopsis: It may sound like chump change in the real estate world, but in a small outback Queensland town, $110,000 is enough to buy you a two-bedroom house — albeit without a stove.

title.children: Two bedrooms, air conditioning and no stove: would you buy Queensland's cheapest habitable home?

image.altText: A slightly smiling middle-aged man wearing a white shirt and suit jacket with green grass, high rises in the background.

props.synopsis: The Greens have unveiled a $40 million commitment to acquire the racecourse if they win power in the upcoming election. But the Brisbane Racing Club says the race course is the "golden goose" of Queensland's racing industry.

title.children: Racing club says Brisbane's Eagle Farm racecourse is not for sale amid Greens push to acquire site

image.altText: Brisbane Broncos' Ezra Mam runs with the ball in the NRL season opener in Las Vegas against the Sydney Roosters.

props.synopsis: Broncos coach Kevin Walters backs his player Ezra Mam, after Mam alleged he was the victim of a racist slur from Roosters opponent Spencer Leniu.

title.children: 'Ezra has every right to be upset': Walters addresses racism allegations as Broncos and Roosters return home

image.altText: An aerial photograph of a black submarine at the surface of the sea

props.synopsis: As Australians wait for the nuclear-powered subs that come with the AUKUS deal, some defence experts are worried the whole thing could fall apart.

title.children: 'The whole thing will just come apart': Why some defence experts are worried about AUKUS

props.synopsis: A team of United Nations experts have reported that there were "reasonable grounds to believe" sexual violence, including rape and gang rape, occurred at several locations during Hamas' October 7 attacks on Israel.

title.children: UN says there are 'reasonable grounds to believe' Hamas committed sexual violence during October 7 attacks
